snippet: The historic choice of Josefina Vázquez Mota as its presidential candidate may turn out to be a shrewd move for the party of Mexico’s incumbent president, political analysts said Monday.
abstract: Josefina Vazquez Mota's nomination by the National Action Party makes her the first woman to run for president in Mexico on a major-party ticket; political analysts say historic choice may turn out to be shrewd move for the party of country's incumbent president; she is an economist and the former education secretary; she has tried to capitalize on her gender, not as a feminist, but as a comforting maternal figure rooted in traditional values.
lead_paragraph: The historic choice of Josefina Vázquez Mota as its presidential candidate may turn out to be a shrewd move for the party of Mexico’s incumbent president, political analysts said Monday.

headline.seo: Vázquez Mota’s Nomination Paves New Path in Mexico
headline.main: Nomination Paves New Path in Mexico
headline.print_headline: Nomination Paves New Path in Mexico
